TextSection.Contents: A rare form of salmonellosis caused by Salmonella enterica serovar Paratyphi A B and C characterized by typical symptoms of enteric fever including high fever headache abdominal pain and intestinal symptoms dry cough chills and rashes followed by a long period of recovery. The infection can be complicated by intestinal hemorrhage and perforation as well as cardiac involvement and may even be fatal. Transmission of the pathogen is via the fecal-oral route with humans as the sole reservoir of infection.
